name: Cat-Cow Pose
instructions: Start on hands and knees in tabletop position
Inhale and arch your back, lifting chest and tailbone (Cow)
Exhale and round your spine, tucking chin to chest (Cat)
Repeat 10-15 times, flowing with breath
precautions: Avoid if you have severe back injury
Keep movements gentle and controlled
Stop if you feel sharp pain

name: Child's Pose
benefits: Calms the mind and nervous system
instructions: Kneel on the floor with knees hip-width apart
Sit back on your heels
Exhale and fold forward, extending arms in front
Rest forehead on the floor
Hold for 1-3 minutes, breathing deeply
precautions: Avoid if you have knee injury
Use props under knees if needed
Don't force the stretch

name: Warrior II
instructions: Stand with feet wide apart
Turn right foot out 90 degrees, left foot slightly in
Bend right knee over right ankle
Extend arms parallel to floor
Gaze over right fingertips
Hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute
precautions: Keep knee aligned over ankle
Don't let knee extend past toes
Avoid if you have severe knee problems

name: Downward-Facing Dog
benefits: Calms the brain and relieves stress
instructions: Start on hands and knees
Tuck toes under and lift hips up
Straighten legs as much as comfortable
Press hands firmly into mat
Keep spine long and straight
Hold for 1-3 minutes
precautions: Avoid if you have severe wrist problems
Bend knees if hamstrings are tight
Don't force the stretch

name: Cobra Pose
instructions: Lie face down on the floor
Place palms under shoulders
Press tops of feet into floor
Inhale and lift chest off floor
Keep elbows close to body
Hold for 15-30 seconds
precautions: Avoid if you have severe back injury
Don't overarch the back
Keep shoulders away from ears

name: Bridge Pose
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent
Place feet hip-width apart
Press feet into floor and lift hips
Interlace fingers under body
Hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute
precautions: Avoid if you have severe neck injury
Don't turn head while in pose
Keep knees aligned over ankles

name: Triangle Pose
instructions: Stand with feet wide apart
Turn right foot out 90 degrees
Extend arms parallel to floor
Hinge at hip and reach right hand to shin
Extend left arm up
Hold for 30 seconds
precautions: Don't force the stretch
Keep both sides of torso long
Avoid if you have severe back problems

name: Legs Up the Wall
instructions: Sit close to a wall
Lie back and swing legs up wall
Rest arms by sides
Close eyes and breathe deeply
Hold for 5-15 minutes
precautions: Avoid if you have severe back problems
Use props under hips if needed
Come out slowly

name: Mountain Pose
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, grounding evenly through all corners of the feet
Lengthen through the spine, lifting the crown of the head toward the sky
Relax shoulders away from ears and engage the core
Keep arms active by your sides or reach overhead
Breathe steadily for 1-2 minutes
precautions: Slightly bend knees if you have lower back sensitivity
Distribute weight evenly to avoid ankle strain

name: Seated Forward Bend
benefits: Helps relieve mild depression and anxiety
instructions: Sit with legs extended and feet flexed
Inhale to lengthen the spine
Exhale and hinge at the hips, reaching toward the feet
Keep spine long, resting hands on legs or feet
Hold for 1-3 minutes with steady breathing
precautions: Use a strap if hamstrings are tight
Avoid rounding the spine excessively
Bend knees slightly if needed

name: Boat Pose
instructions: Sit with knees bent and feet on floor
Lean back slightly while keeping spine long
Lift feet to shin height or straighten legs
Reach arms forward parallel to the floor
Hold for 30-60 seconds breathing steadily
precautions: Keep spine long to avoid rounding
Avoid if you have serious lower back issues

name: Camel Pose
instructions: Kneel with knees hip-width apart and toes tucked
Place hands on lower back for support
Inhale and lift the chest, gently pressing hips forward
Reach hands to heels or keep on back for support
Hold for 20-40 seconds while breathing deeply
precautions: Keep neck neutral if you feel strain
Engage core to protect lower back
Avoid if you have uncontrolled high blood pressure

name: Pigeon Pose
instructions: From Downward Dog, bring right knee toward right wrist
Slide left leg back, keeping hips square
Keep chest lifted or fold forward over front leg
Hold for 1-2 minutes, then switch sides
precautions: Place blanket under hips for support
Avoid if you have acute knee injury
Keep front foot flexed to protect the knee

name: Cow Face Pose
benefits: Relieves tension from long hours of sitting
instructions: Sit with knees stacked, right knee over left
Reach right arm up and bend elbow
Reach left arm behind and clasp fingers or use a strap
Lift chest and keep spine tall
Hold for 45-60 seconds and switch sides
precautions: Use a strap if hands do not reach
Keep hips grounded evenly on the floor

name: Locust Pose
instructions: Lie on belly with arms alongside body
On inhalation, lift chest, head, arms, and legs off the mat
Reach through fingers and toes while keeping neck long
Hold for 30-45 seconds with steady breath
precautions: Avoid compressing lower back
Keep gaze down to protect neck

name: Supine Spinal Twist
instructions: Lie on back and hug knees into chest
Drop knees to the right while extending arms out in a T shape
Keep shoulders grounded and gaze left
Hold for 1-2 minutes, then switch sides
precautions: Stack knees with blanket support if needed
Avoid forcing the twist

name: Tree Pose
instructions: Stand tall in Mountain Pose
Shift weight to left foot
Place right foot on left inner thigh or calf (avoid knee)
Bring hands to prayer position at chest
Find a focal point and hold for 30-60 seconds
precautions: Avoid placing foot directly on knee joint
Use wall for support if needed
Keep standing leg strong

name: Plank Pose
instructions: Start in tabletop or Downward Dog
Shift forward until shoulders are over wrists
Straighten legs and engage core
Keep body in a straight line from head to heels
Hold for 30-60 seconds
precautions: Don't let hips sag or lift too high
Modify with knees on floor if needed
Avoid if you have wrist pain

name: Goddess Pose
instructions: Stand with feet wide apart, toes turned out
Bend knees deeply, tracking over toes
Raise arms to cactus shape (bent at 90 degrees)
Keep spine straight and core engaged
Hold for 30-60 seconds
precautions: Keep knees aligned with toes
Don't lean forward
Avoid if you have knee or hip injury

name: Butterfly Pose
instructions: Sit with spine tall and bring soles of feet together
Let knees fall out to the sides
Hold feet or ankles and gently lengthen the spine
Stay for 1–3 minutes with slow breathing
precautions: Sit on a cushion if lower back rounds
Support knees with blocks if hips are tight

name: Chair Pose
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart and bend knees as if sitting on a chair
Keep weight in heels and lift chest
Reach arms overhead beside ears
Hold for 30–45 seconds with steady breath
precautions: Avoid if you have acute knee pain
Keep knees tracking over toes

name: Corpse Pose
instructions: Lie flat on your back with legs comfortably apart
Rest arms by sides with palms facing up
Soften the face and jaw, close the eyes
Breathe naturally for 5–10 minutes
precautions: Use support under knees if lower back is sensitive
Cover with a blanket if you feel cold

name: Crescent Lunge
instructions: From standing, step one foot back into a lunge
Bend front knee over ankle and straighten back leg
Lift arms overhead and lengthen through spine
Hold for 30–45 seconds, then switch sides
precautions: Avoid deep lunge if you have knee issues
Keep front knee aligned over ankle

name: Crescent Moon Pose
benefits: Relieves tension in waist and lower back
instructions: Stand with feet together and reach arms overhead
Clasp hands and lean gently to one side
Keep both sides of the torso long
Hold for 20–30 seconds each side
precautions: Avoid deep bending if you have acute back pain
Engage core to support lower back

name: Crow Pose
instructions: Squat with feet hip-width and place hands on floor shoulder-width apart
Lift hips and place knees on upper arms
Shift weight forward and lift feet off the floor
Hold for 5–10 breaths
precautions: Avoid if you have wrist or shoulder injuries
Use a cushion in front if you feel unstable

name: Dolphin Pose
instructions: Start on hands and knees, then lower forearms to the floor
Tuck toes and lift hips up like Downward Dog
Press forearms firmly into the mat
Hold for 5–10 breaths
precautions: Avoid if you have acute shoulder injuries
Keep neck relaxed and gaze between feet

name: Eagle Pose
instructions: Stand on one leg and wrap the other around it
Cross arms at elbows and wrists in front of chest
Sit hips down slightly and lift elbows
Hold for 20–30 seconds, then switch sides
precautions: Use a wall for support if balance is challenging
Avoid deep knee bend with knee injury

name: Extended Hand to Big Toe Pose
instructions: Stand tall and shift weight to one leg
Lift opposite leg and hold big toe or use a strap
Extend leg forward or to the side while keeping spine tall
Hold for 15–30 seconds, then switch sides
precautions: Practice near a wall if balance is unsteady
Keep a micro-bend in standing knee

name: Extended Side Angle Pose
benefits: Relieves stiffness in waist and lower back
instructions: From Warrior II, lower front forearm to thigh or hand to the floor
Extend top arm over ear, creating a long line from foot to fingertips
Rotate chest open and gaze upward if comfortable
Hold for 30–45 seconds each side
precautions: Use a block for support if hand doesn’t reach the floor
Avoid collapsing into the front shoulder

name: Forearm Stand
instructions: Start in Dolphin Pose with forearms on the floor
Walk feet closer and gently kick one leg up, then the other
Stack hips over shoulders and engage core
Hold for a few breaths, then come down with control
precautions: Practice near a wall if you are a beginner
Avoid with neck, shoulder, or back injuries

name: Half Boat Pose
instructions: Sit with knees bent and feet on the floor
Lean back slightly and lift feet to knee height
Extend arms forward parallel to the floor
Hold for 20–40 seconds with steady breath
precautions: Avoid if you have acute lower back pain
Keep spine long, not rounded

name: Half Moon Pose
instructions: From Triangle Pose, bend front knee and place hand in front of foot
Lift back leg parallel to the floor and open hips to the side
Extend top arm upward and gaze to the side or up
Hold for 20–30 seconds each side
precautions: Use a block under the hand for support
Practice near a wall if balance is challenging

name: Handstand
benefits: Builds upper body and core strength
instructions: Face a wall and place hands shoulder-width apart
Kick one leg up, then the other, coming into an inverted position
Engage core and press strongly through hands
Hold for a few breaths, then come down with control
precautions: Practice with a teacher if you are new to inversions
Avoid with wrist, shoulder, or neck injuries

name: King Pigeon Pose
benefits: Deeply opens hips and hip flexors
instructions: From Pigeon Pose, bend back knee and reach arms to hold the foot
Lift chest and gently draw foot toward head
Keep hips square and breathe slowly
Hold for 5–8 breaths, then switch sides
precautions: Only practice after warming up thoroughly
Avoid with knee, hip, or low back injuries

name: Lotus Pose
benefits: Calms the mind and nervous system
instructions: Sit with legs extended, then place one foot on opposite thigh
Place the other foot on the opposite thigh if comfortable
Lengthen spine and rest hands on knees
Breathe slowly for 3–5 minutes
precautions: Avoid if you have knee or hip injuries
Use easy cross-legged seat as an alternative

name: Low Lunge
benefits: Relieves tension in groin and thighs
instructions: From tabletop, step one foot forward between hands
Lower back knee to the floor and untuck toes
Lift chest and optionally reach arms overhead
Hold for 30–45 seconds, then switch sides
precautions: Place padding under the back knee if sensitive
Avoid deep lunge if you feel knee or hip pain

name: Plow Pose
instructions: From lying on your back, lift legs overhead into Shoulder Stand
Lower toes toward the floor behind your head
Support lower back with hands if needed
Hold for 5–8 breaths, then roll down slowly
precautions: Avoid with neck or spinal injuries
Do not turn the head while in the pose

name: Pyramid Pose
instructions: Step feet into a short stance with hips facing forward
Square hips and hinge at the hips over front leg
Place hands on shin, blocks, or floor
Hold for 30–45 seconds each side
precautions: Use blocks if hands don’t reach the floor
Micro-bend front knee if hamstrings are tight

name: Reverse Warrior
instructions: From Warrior II, keep front knee bent and slide back hand down rear leg
Reach front arm up and back, lengthening side body
Keep front knee steady over ankle
Hold for 20–30 seconds each side
precautions: Avoid collapsing into lower back
Engage core for support

name: Side Plank Pose
instructions: From Plank Pose, shift weight onto one hand and outer edge of same-side foot
Stack feet and extend top arm to the sky
Keep hips lifted and body in one line
Hold for 20–30 seconds each side
precautions: Practice with bottom knee down if wrists are sensitive
Avoid with acute wrist or shoulder pain

name: Wide-Legged Seated Forward Bend
instructions: Sit with legs wide apart and toes pointing up
Inhale to lengthen the spine, exhale to fold forward
Rest hands on floor or a bolster
Hold for 1–3 minutes with relaxed breathing
precautions: Sit on a cushion if lower back rounds
Avoid forcing the stretch

name: Full Splits
benefits: Deeply stretches hamstrings and hip flexors
Improves flexibility in legs and hips
instructions: From a low lunge, gradually slide front heel forward and back knee backward
Support hips with blocks or props as needed
Keep chest lifted and breathe slowly
Hold for 5–8 breaths on each side
precautions: Warm up thoroughly before practicing
Avoid if you have hamstring or groin injuries

name: Upward-Facing Dog
instructions: Lie face down with hands beside ribs
Press into hands, straighten arms, and lift chest and thighs off the floor
Roll shoulders back and broaden collarbones
Hold for 5–8 breaths
precautions: Avoid with acute lower back pain
Keep shoulders away from ears

name: Warrior I
instructions: Step one foot back and turn it slightly out
Bend front knee over ankle and square hips forward
Reach arms overhead and lengthen through spine
Hold for 30–45 seconds each side
precautions: Shorten the stance if you feel low back compression
Avoid locking the back knee

name: Warrior III
instructions: From standing, hinge at hips and extend one leg back
Reach arms forward or back, forming a straight line from fingertips to heel
Keep hips level and gaze slightly forward
Hold for 15–30 seconds each side
precautions: Use a wall or chair for support if needed
Avoid locking standing knee

name: Wheel Pose
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent and feet hip-width
Place hands beside ears with fingers pointing toward shoulders
Press into hands and feet to lift hips and chest
Hold for 3–5 breaths, then lower slowly
precautions: Warm up with gentler backbends first
Avoid with wrist, shoulder, or spine injuries

name: Wild Thing
benefits: Releases tension in front body and hips
instructions: From Side Plank, step top foot behind and lift hips
Arch back and let top arm reach overhead and back
Keep supporting shoulder strong and stable
Hold for 3–5 breaths each side
precautions: Avoid with shoulder or wrist injuries
Come out slowly to protect lower back
